column4: hey all, i have a security question on vnc: i use a vnc viewer to remote to my ubuntu desktop from my laptop (win xp) in the same house. I port forwarded my router (port 5900) so that i could connect from my work as well. When i got home tonight I noticed there were x2 other users connected and i cut them off right away. How is this possible? I set it so that you have to enter an 8 character pw to take control when you remote i
using vnc over the internet without a ssh tunnle is NOT a good idea.
well.. you had 2 other users connected.. :) so logicially YES a password is not enough security
time to be viruschecking  and possibially reinstalling that windows box.
